security_audit.summary: This is a documentation-only skill with no executable code. It describes container management capabilities for Proxmox environments but contains no scripts, network calls, or file operations.

content.user_title: Manage LXC containers in Proxmox environments
content.value_statement: Proxmox container management can be complex and time-consuming. This skill simplifies container operations with intuitive commands for lifecycle management, monitoring, and optimization.
limitations: Requires Proxmox environment with LXC support
Cannot manage Docker or Kubernetes containers

use_cases.title: Automate container deployments
use_cases.description: Streamline container creation and management across Proxmox nodes without manual GUI operations

use_cases.title: Monitor container health
use_cases.description: Track container status, resource usage, and performance metrics for proactive maintenance

use_cases.title: Create test environments
use_cases.description: Quickly provision isolated containers for testing applications and services

best_practices: Monitor container resource usage regularly to prevent over-allocation
Use graceful shutdown when possible to avoid data corruption
Document container purposes and configurations for team visibility
anti_patterns: Creating containers without resource limits can impact node performance
Ignoring container logs makes troubleshooting difficult
Running unnecessary services in containers wastes resources

faq.question: Which Proxmox versions are compatible?
faq.answer: Works with Proxmox VE 6.x and later versions that support LXC containers

faq.question: Can I manage Docker containers?
faq.answer: No, this skill is specifically for LXC containers in Proxmox environments

faq.question: Does it integrate with existing Proxmox clusters?
faq.answer: Yes, operates on any node in your Proxmox cluster with appropriate permissions

faq.question: Is my container data safe during operations?
faq.answer: Yes, all operations use Proxmox APIs which maintain data integrity

faq.question: What if a container fails to start?
faq.answer: Check container logs and resource allocation, then use reboot or diagnostic commands

faq.question: How does this compare to Proxmox web UI?
faq.answer: Provides faster CLI-based management with automation capabilities for repetitive tasks
